1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Eliphaz, the name of one of Job's friends, and of a son of Esau
a Temanite or descendant of Teman

2.brief: to test; by implication, to attempt
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
near, with or among; often in general, to
to tire; (figuratively) to be (or make) disgusted
to inclose; by analogy, to hold back; also to maintain, rule, assemble
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)

3.brief: to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer

4.brief: to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
to bend the knee; by implication, to sink, to prostrate
to be alert, physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage)

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to tire; (figuratively) to be (or make) disgusted

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously

6.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
in a good sense, trust; in a bad one, silliness
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

7.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
what place?; also (of time) when?; or (of means) how?
to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy

8.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain)

9.brief: a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)

10.brief: a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)

11.brief: properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to roar; a lion (properly, a lioness as the fiercer (although not a roarer;))
to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself)

12.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to thieve (literally or figuratively); by implication, to deceive
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

13.brief: properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

14.brief: a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)
to encounter, whether accidentally or in a hostile manner
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
to be startled (by a sudden alarm); hence, to fear in general

15.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change
to be erect, i.e. bristle as hair
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman

16.brief: to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
a view (the act of seeing); also an appearance (the thing seen), whether (real) a shape (especially if handsome, comeliness; often plural the looks), or (mental) a vision
something portioned (i.e. fashioned) out, as ashape, i.e. (indefinitely) phantom, or (specifically) embodiment, or (figuratively) manifestation (of favor)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

17.brief: a man in general (singly or collectively)
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to be pure (physical sound, clear, unadulterated; Levitically, uncontaminated; morally, innocent or holy)
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply

18.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

19.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, a bubbling up, i.e. of water, a wave; of earth, mire or clay (cement); also a heap; hence, a chomer or dry measure
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to crumble; transitively, to bruise (literally or figuratively)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

20.brief: properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)

21.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
properly, an overhanging, i.e. (by implication) an excess, superiority, remainder; also a small rope (as hanging free)
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
